title: [BUG] Cubic antialiasing path isn't draw on OpenGL
body:
**Description**

Cubic antialiasing path isn't draw on OpenGL in Windows console project.

**Code**

```cs
            var paint = new SKPaint()
            {
                Color = SKColors.White.WithAlpha(100),
                Style = SKPaintStyle.Stroke,
                StrokeWidth = 2,
                IsAntialias = true
            };

            {
                var path = new SKPath();
                path.MoveTo(0, 0);
                path.LineTo(100, 200);
                canv.DrawPath(path, paint); //is on screen
            }

            {
                var path = new SKPath();
                path.MoveTo(30, 40);
                path.CubicTo(50, 60, 100, 150, 300, 200);
                canv.DrawPath(path, paint); //is NOT on screen
            }
```

**Expected Behavior**

I want to see line and arc on screen. 

**Actual Behavior**

I see only line, not arc.

**Basic Information**

- Version with issue:  2.80.2
- Last known good version:  <!-- the version of SkiaSharp that still working -->
- IDE:  Visual Studio Community 2019 Version 16.7.1
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  - Windows Classic:  Windows 10
  

<details>
  <summary>Detailed IDE/OS information (click to expand)</summary>
  
```

Geforce GTX 760
Driver 26.21.14.3200

```
</details>


**Screenshots**

NO antialiasing, all lines are present
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7722773/97773141-62006180-1b5e-11eb-8992-578f9b355241.png)

WITH antialiasing, it's only one line
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7722773/97773158-7fcdc680-1b5e-11eb-8083-c1f630d37d8c.png)


**Reproduction Link**

https://cemm302.visualstudio.com/_git/SkiaTest?path=%2FSkiaTest
